situation.title: Services
situation.meta_description: Providing service trades is not allowed at this time.

content.processed:
​​​​​​Rules and recommendations

Providing services is not allowed now.

Only certain services are allowed to operate, specifically: car repair shops and towing service, deliveries and messengers, electronics and home appliances repair shops, locksmiths, financial advisors, building and demolishing companies, and saloons for cats and dogs.

Any kind of service which is not on the list of exceptions is not allowed to operate. Exceptions do not cover for example barber shops, hairdressers, manicure and pedicure, massages, beauticians, etc. Though, it is possible to make an appointment at your home as the prohibition applies only to providing a service at the place of business. With respect to the risk of infection being still high, we highly recommend making an appointment only when truly necessary.

Once meeting with the service provider is set, please follow hygienic rules during the meeting – wear your face mask, keep spacing and disinfect your hands regularly.

You can visit the store/shopping mall in a group of 6 people at most with a valid exception for families. The store must guarantee at least 15 m² of space per customer. In stores smaller than 15 m² this restriction does not apply to children under 15 and people with disabilities. In stores bigger than 15 m², children under 6 with a company of adult person are excluded.

A priority entrance is ensured for persons with disability to prevent them from waiting in long queues.

It is also mandatory to adopt regime and organizational measures and queue management (in front of and in the shop).

Minor repairs in the household and hairdresser visit should be postponed in these days. Please use service providers only in cases of necessity. If so, please pay increased attention to hygiene – keep spacing and use contactless payment. Please be careful and responsible. By respecting these rules, you help us to protect you and other people.

questions_answers.question: Can I use a delivery or messenger service?
questions_answers.value: Yes. You can for example order your meal online and eat it at home thanks to delivery service.

questions_answers.question: Can I user an upholstery service?
questions_answers.value: Yes. You can make an appointment out of the store, e.g. in a workroom.

Can I make an appointment with hairdresser/manicurist at my home?
questions_answers.value: Yes. With respect to the risk of infection being still high, we highly recommend making an appointment only when truly necessary.

questions_answers.question: Can I dye my hair at home?
Can I book a massage or book private physiotherapist?
Can I use the services of a lawyer?
questions_answers.value: Yes, lawyers and other special professions not based on Trade Licencing Act are exempt from the ban on services.

questions_answers.question: Can I exchange my money at exchange point?
Can car rentals work?
questions_answers.value: Yes. Bike, car, caravan and pickup rentals are allowed to operate. However, the rental must be arranged individually outside the place of business

questions_answers.question: Do taxi services remain in operation?
questions_answers.value: Yes. Jobs and services related to providing transport are not banned. Urban and public transport also remain in operation.  Both driver and client are obliged to wear a face mask.
